posts.postText: The situation in #Gaza is catastrophic. ¬†With two months of an aid blockade, we don‚Äôt need to see photos of emaciated children to know people are hungry, and that children are weak and malnourished, with life-long consequences. ¬†Ceasefire, for the release of hostages and for access of humanitarian aid.

Vaccines are rigorously tested, they are effective, and they save lives. More than 150 million lives have been saved in the past 50 years thanks to vaccines!But you may be worried about what‚Äôs in them? So, let‚Äôs break it down! #WorldImmunisationWeek

All 25 supported bakeries in Gaza have now shut down.As the blockade on Gaza continues for over a month, people face growing risks of severe hunger, malnutrition, and lack of adequate health care. Urgent humanitarian access is critical to resume lifesaving services#ceasefire
It‚Äôs really wrong to weaponize food. It‚Äòs very wrong to weaponize medical supplies. The hospitals in #Gaza are on their knees. Peace is the best medicine.‚Äî @DrTedros #WHA78
The point of the #PandemicAccord is the people of our world.It is about making the world safer for them, and their children and grandchildren.#WHA78

Tobacco and nicotine products look sweet BUT sinisterüíÄ#TobaccoExposedThat bubblegum, mango, or cotton candy flavour isn‚Äôt just for taste. It‚Äôs a trap to get young people hooked!Don‚Äôt fall for the illusion. Unmask the appeal.

The birth of a child can be a time of great joy. But not everyone has a straightforward, positive experience with pregnancy and childbirth.Listen to Leslie Sedillo, a medical doctor and mother from the #Philippines, as she talks about how Kangaroo Mother Care helped her baby thrive and become as active as other kids her age. ‚ù§ #HopefulFutures

Young people will live with the consequences of today‚Äôs decisions. The adoption of the #PandemicAgreement by world leaders matters big time! #WHA78

It‚Äôs official: the #PandemicAccord is adopted by the World Health Assembly!My warmest congratulations to @who Member States for their commitment to keeping their people and the world safer.What a moment in global health history. Together!

We are here to serve not our own interests, but the eight billion people of our world;To leave a heritage for those who come after us;And to work together for a healthier, more peaceful and more equitable world.#WHA78

#TransFats are commonly found in margarines, vegetable shortening, baked and fried foods and pre-packaged snacks.  A recent WHO study found that every 2% increase in energy intake from trans fats significantly raises the risk of: üíî heart disease by 25% üòê death from any cause by 14%

Global consumption of alcohol has reduced by 0.7 litres per capita between 2010 and 2022. This is a significant step towards achieving the target of reducing alcohol consumption by 20% by 2030.

Tired of all the misinformation around the #PandemicAccord? We got you.Stay informed. Stick with facts.And share this video. At #WHA78, starting 19th May, tune in to all conversations around this historic agreement. #PlotTwist

The 30 million nurses are the heart of health systems worldwide.From emergency response to long-term care, from birth to end-of-life, nurses are everywhere health happens.WHO urges accelerated investments to avoid a projected 4 million nurse shortage by 2030.Because when #nurses are supported, everyone thrives.

We asked pedestrians & cyclists how they would improve #RoadSafety in the city. They had great ideasüí¨ ‚ÄúExpanding sidewalks.‚Äù üí¨ ‚ÄúLess cars.‚Äù üí¨ ‚ÄúBarriers between cycle paths and cars.‚Äù When safer, walking & cycling can contribute to making ‚úîÔ∏è people more active & healthier ‚úîÔ∏è cities sustainable with ‚¨áÔ∏è reliance on private cars, ‚¨áÔ∏è air & noise pollution ‚úîÔ∏è societies equitable where everyone has the same degree of access to what the city offers#RoadSafety

Maternal conditions and breast cancer, as well as higher rates of health problems like back & neck pain, gynaecological diseases, migraines, depression, and anxiety, reduced women's lead in healthy life expectancy compared to men. Read more in the newly released World Health Statistics Report 2025.

Did you experience anxiety or depression during the pandemic? Higher level of mental health challenges during the first two years of the COVID-19 pandemic shortened healthy life expectancy by 22 days. Read more in the newly released World Health Statistics Report 2025.

Formula milk marketing exploits parental anxieties about common infant behaviours such as fussiness or poor sleep. Premium branding is paraded as having ‚Äúpremium benefits‚Äù, when in fact the only difference is the price. Claims made by the formula milk industry about their products are often misleading, scientifically unsubstantiated & violate the International Code of Marketing of Breast-milk Substitutes. WHO is calling on governments to #EndExploitativeMarketing & protect babies‚Äô health.

European #Gaza Hospital ‚Äî where 12 @who staff and 284 patients and companions were gathered for a pre-coordinated medical evacuation ‚Äî was attacked on 13 May causing death and distress. While none in the evacuation group were harmed, the attack reportedly resulted in six deaths and 40 injuries on the hospital premises.Despite the high-risk conditions, WHO successfully carried out the medical evacuation yesterday to Italy, Turkey, Romania, Jordan, and the UAE via the Kerem Shalom crossing.This morning, renewed hostilities near the hospital terrified staff and patients and obstructed access to the facility.Hospitals must be safeguarded so they can serve their life-saving function.Hospitals must be protected. They must never be militarized or targeted.Ceasefire!
Did you know‚ùì Women make up 85% of the nursing workforce, yet in most countries they still earn less than men doing the same job.It‚Äôs time to close the gap because equal work deserves equal pay.

Did you know‚ùì Cycle lanes count for just 0.2% of the current road infrastructure. It‚Äôs time to demand safer streets that put the health & safety of pedestrians and cyclists first. #RoadSafety #StreetsforLife

Today is #InternationalNursesDay.Did you know‚ùì Nearly 80% of nurses work in countries that make up just under half of the world‚Äôs population.High income countries, with only 17% of the global population, employ nearly half (46%) of all #nurses.This means millions are left without adequate maternal & child care, chronic disease management, emergency health response and much more.

Did you know? Gloves üß§ can get contaminated as easily as bare hands.When medical gloves are misused or overused, they may not serve as a protective equipment rather become  potential means of germ transmission.

Alcohol consumption is rising among young people across many low- & middle-income countries, especially among young women. Meanwhile, drinking rates remain high in high-income countries.Here are the risks & why you should care.

What Can One Boy‚Äôs Survival Teach Us About Strength and Solidarity? At just 10 years old, Roman Oleksiv is a true survivor. In July 2022, while waiting for a doctor‚Äôs appointment in Vinnytsia, Ukraine, a missile strike claimed the life of his mother and left Roman with extensive burns. Thanks to Ukraine‚Äôs medical evacuation programme‚Äîsupported by WHO and partner countries and co-funded through the EU, ‚ÄîRoman was swiftly transported to Germany for life-saving treatment. More than 100 days in intensive care. 35 surgeries. Months of rehabilitation. ü©∞üé∂ Today, Roman is not just walking‚Äîhe‚Äôs dancing, and inspiring everyone he meets. His message? üí¨ ‚ÄúNever give up.‚Äù His recovery is a testament to his spirit, and to what coordinated, cross-border emergency care can achieve. Medevac is a system made possible by generous donors and dedicated health professionals. To everyone who helped make Roman‚Äôs recovery possible‚Äîthank you. üôè
Guess what? #VaccinesWork. They protect us against more than 30 deadly diseases. Choose science, choose health. #HumanlyPossible
Did you know? Where you live and your social group shape your health more than genes or healthcare. It‚Äôs time to challenge inequity!
